children.name: smell b1
children.definition: smel/  to notice the smell of sth, especially by putting your nose near it:ngửi
examples: smell these roses - aren’t they lovely?
if you smell gas in the apartment, call this number immediately.
i swear i haven’t had anything to drink. smell my breath.
can smellnotice a smell:nghe mùi
i can smell something burning - are you sure you turned the oven off?

children.name: catch a whiff of sth x
children.definition: get/ catch a whiff of sth informal to notice a smell, just for a short time:nghe có mùi gì
examples: i caught a whiff of roast beef as i walked past the kitchen.
lisa passed so close to paul that he got a whiff of her perfume.
he leaned towards me and icaught/got awhiffofgarlic.

children.name: scent x
children.definition: scent if ananimalscents sth, especially another animal, it can smell that it is near:đánh hơi ( động vật )
examples: the dog had scented something in the bushes.
police dogs have a very keen sense of smell and can scent even the slightest traces of drugs.

children.name: sniff c2
children.partOfSpeech: [i or t verb not in passive]
children.definition: sniff to take quick breaths through your nose in order to smell something:khịt mũi để ngửi
examples: he opened the milk and sniffed it.
otto looked around quickly to make sure no one was looking and then sniffed his armpits.
sniff atkhịt ngửi gì
the dog was rushing around excitedly, sniffing at the ground.

children.name: smell b1
children.definition: smell sth that you notice by using your nose:mùi
examples: what’s that smell? is something burning?
we had the carpet cleaned, but we couldn’t get rid of the musty smell.
the wonderful smells from the kitchen made her mouth water.
smell of
i really hate the smell of stale beer.

children.name: scent x
children.definition: scent a smell produced by an animal that acts as a signal to other animals: mùi hơi (của thú)
examples: the dogs followed the fox’s scent to the edge of the forest.
scent of
the hounds had lost the scent of the fox near the river.

children.name: smell b1
children.definition: smell  to have an unpleasant smell:bốc mùi
examples: does my breath smell?
we need to clean the cat’s litter box - it’s starting to smell.
smell bad/ awful/ terrible/ disgusting
not only does he smell bad - he’s mean and ugly too.
many people like the taste of jackfruit, but it smells terrible.
smelly[adj] having an unpleasant smell rất có mùi
the hut was dark and smelly.
don’t leave your smelly sneakers lying around the living room.
the lake was rapidly turning brown and smelly from the factory wastes.

children.name: reek x
children.definition: reek to have a very strong smell of something unpleasant:nặng mùi
examples: get that dog out of here - he reeks.
reek of
he came running into the house, reeking of sweat.
the tiny office reeked of onions and cigarette smoke.
where have you been - you reek of alcohol?

children.name: musty x
children.definition: musty things such as books, clothes, or rooms that are musty have a smell that is old and not fresh, especially because they have not been used or been in fresh air for a long time:mùi mốc
examples: the hotel room was dark and musty.
the library was full of musty old books which no one wanted to read.

children.name: stink x
children.definition: stink to have a strong and unpleasant smell:nặng mùi
examples: her room is filthy, and it stinks.
how can you eat that cheese? it stinks.
stink of
his clothes stank of cigarette smoke.
stink to high heaven
you boys stink to high heaven - go inside and take a shower.
stinking[attri adj] having a very strong unpleasant smell:có mùi khó ngửi
the yards were full of stinking garbage cans, and untidy lines of washing.
he pointed to the stinking hole that we were to use as a toilet.
stink the place out[uk] /stinktheplaceup[us] [vp]informalto make a wholeroomsmell bad:
you’re not bringing that cat in here - it’ll stink the place out.
she made fish for dinner and stunk the place up.

children.name: stale c1
children.definition: stale having a smell that is not fresh, especially because you can still smell sth such as old cigarette smoke or old cooking smells:mùi hôi để lâu
examples: she noticed the stale smell of drink on his breath.
the air in the office was stale and heavy.
it was cold outside and the smell of stale tobacco clung to their winter coats.

children.name: acrid x
children.definition: acrid having a sharp, unpleasant smell, especially one that hurts your nose:chua
examples: the chemical has an acrid smell.
when i opened the door, acrid white smoke came billowing out.
the air was stale and acrid, and a cluster of black flies hovered over the bed.

children.name: bad smell b1
children.definition: smellmùihơi
examples: there’s a smell in here - open the window.
the food looked good, but the smell was awful.
smell of
the smells of dead fish and rotting garbage were more than he could stand.
bad smell[more specific]
there was a bad smell coming from the cupboard.

children.name: odor c2
children.definition: odour /odor   a strong, unpleasant smell that is easy to recognize:mùi hôi
examples: the air freshener is supposed to get rid of unpleasant household odors.
odour of
around the camps there was always the pungent order of kerosene burning human waste.
body odour/ odor: mùi cơ thể
the man sitting next to me had body odor and bad breath.

children.name: stench x
children.definition: stench a very strong unpleasant smell, especially one that is so bad it makes it hard for you to breathe or makes you feel sick:mùi khó ngửi
examples: the dead body had begun to rot, and the stench was overpowering.
anoverpoweringstench
stench of
i couldn’t bear to go in the room with its stench of beer and vomit.

children.name: stink x
children.definition: stink a strong and very unpleasant smell, especially from sth that is decaying:có mùi phân hủy
examples: the stink from the drains is almost unbearable in summer.
stink of
the stink of burning rubber permeated the hot summer air.

children.name: pong x
children.definition: pong  a bad smell:mùi hôi
examples: what a pong! this place hasn’t been cleaned for years!

children.name: strong b1
children.definition: strong nặng mùi
examples: there’s a strong smell of gas in here.
her perfume is so strong - it makes me gag.
goat’s cheese has a strong smell.
strong-smelling
pete had covered himself in strong-smelling aftershave.

children.name: powerful b1
children.definition: powerful very strong, and sometimes unpleasant:nặng mùi
examples: ammonia has a very powerful, distinctive smell.
the powerful smell of cabbage, sardines, and body odor filled the train.

children.name: heady x
children.definition: heady
examples: heady smell/scent/perfume a smell etcthat is very strong and sweet, like a powerful smell of flowers:nồngnặc
a heady scent of jasmine hung in the summer air.
diane loved the blossoms and the heady aroma of the wild rose bush.

children.name: pungent x
children.definition: pungent having a very strong, sharp, and often unpleasant smell: hăng, cay
examples: garlic has a pungent aroma.
pungent diesel fumes poured from the back of the truck.

children.name: scent b2
children.definition: scent / fragrance / perfume a pleasant smell, especially from flowers, plants, or fruit:mùi hương, hương thơm
examples: the trees were so thick with flowers their scent was almost overpowering.
the flowers have been prized over the centuries for their heady perfume.
scent/ fragrance/ perfume of
the fragrance of lilacs always reminds me of spring.
a cool autumn breeze blew past, carrying with it the scent of pine.

children.name: aroma x
children.definition: aroma a pleasant smell, especially from food or drink:mùi thơm
examples: each of the cheeses has its own texture, flavour, and aroma.
aroma of
the aroma of coffee brought christine into the small cafe.
the rich aroma of freshly baked bread filled the whole house.

children.name: have a good smell b1
children.definition: have a good/ bad etc smell
examples: the wine has a light, lemony smell.
clothes washed in some detergents have a chemical smell.
the house was empty, and the rooms had a stale, damp smell.

children.name: give off x
children.definition: give off sth to produce a particular type of smell that is fairly strong:cho ra mùi
examples: the mixture gave off a strong odor of sulfur.
the covers were damp from humidity and gave off a mildewy smell.
when dried, the flowers will continue to give off their fragrance for months and even years.

children.name: smell b1
children.definition: smellcó mùi
examples: smell of
she smelled of alcohol and was unsteady on her feet.
the whole house smells of garlic - what are you cooking?
smell like
it smells like a hospital in here - has someone been using disinfectant?
smell nice/ horrible/ sweet etc
this hand cream smells lovely, what’s it called?
the meat smelled horrible, and i refused to eat it.

children.name: smell good b1
children.definition: smell nice/ good to have a pleasant smell:
examples: something smells good. what are you cooking?
you smell so good - is that a new perfume?
i put lavender in my cupboard to make my clothes smell nice.

children.name: fragrant c2
children.definition: fragrant having a light, pleasant smell, especially of flowers:có mùi hương nhẹ
examples: the plant has fragrant red and white flowers.
the forest was cool and fragrant, and the walk through it calmed my spirits.
choose from one of chanel’s new range of fragrant body lotions.

children.name: fresh b1
children.definition: fresh having a clean, natural, pleasant smell:
examples: if you eat garlic, have some parsley afterwards to keep your breath fresh.
the fields have such a clean, fresh smell after the rain.

children.name: aromatic x
children.definition: aromatic having a pleasant smell - use this especially about plants and leaves that are used in cooking:thơm(thảo dược)
examples: thai basil is fast growing and wonderfully aromatic.
this kind of massage is a gentle treatment using aromatic oils.
aromatic herbs

children.name: delicate b2
children.definition: delicate a delicate smell is pleasant but sometimes difficult to notice:thoang thoảng
examples: the delicate scent of roses hung in the air
this soup has a marvellous, delicate fragrance and a slightly sweet taste.

children.name: perfumed x
children.definition: perfumed having a strong but pleasant smell - use this especially about sth that has been given a smell by a particular product:hương nước hoa
examples: he stood so close to her that he could smell the perfumed soap on her skin.
perfumed lotions
the poodle came back from the groomers perfumed, with a tiny bow behind each ear.

children.name: sweet-smelling u
children.definition: sweet-smelling having a strong, sweet smell:thơm ngọt ngào
examples: the room was warm, sweet-smelling, and luxurious.
the plant produces tiny, but sweet-smelling white flowers.
the old city lay among sweet-smelling pine woods and almond groves.
